sections.title: PRE-LIFT PLANNING
items: Appointed Person lift plan reviewed and available on site
Risk assessment and method statement briefed to all personnel
Ground conditions assessed and matting / outrigger support confirmed
Weather conditions within limits (wind speed, lightning, visibility)
Equipment certification, LOLER thorough examination in date
Lift route surveyed – overhead obstructions, exclusion zones established
Load weight, centre of gravity and lifting points confirmed

sections.title: LIFT EXECUTION CONTROLS
items: Exclusion zone barriers in place and marshalled
Communication method agreed (radios, hand signals)
Test lift carried out to confirm rigging and balance
Tag lines fitted where necessary
Public interface managed (if near footpaths / highways)
No personnel under suspended loads
Emergency arrangements briefed (e.g. crane failure, dropped load)

sections.title: POST-LIFT & HANDOVER
items: Load landed safely and secured
Rigging gear inspected for damage post-use
Equipment demobilised and stowed correctly
Area returned to normal condition, barriers removed
Any incidents / near misses reported
Permit closed and records updated
